contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul uses "we" to refer to himself and all true believers in Christ, including the Philippian believers. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-inclusive]])
contextId.glQuote: For it is we who are

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul uses "we" to include the Philippian believers. Alternate translation: "let us all continue obeying the same truth we have already received" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-inclusive]])
contextId.quote: εἰς ὃ ἐφθάσαμεν, τῷ αὐτῷ στοιχεῖν
contextId.glQuote: whatever we have reached, let us hold on to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: By Paul's use of "our" and "we" here, he includes himself and the believers in Philippi. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-inclusive]])
